devdoc.details: StrategyFacet is one of the facets of the system, dedicated to strategy management.

params.investTokenPrice: The price of the invest token in USD.
params.stableTokenPrice: The price of the stable token in USD.
params.strategyId: The unique ID of the cancelled strategy.

params.budget: total budget of the user in the stable token
params.investRoundId: Round ID for the invest token price when the strategy is created.
params.parameter: The strategy parameter including settings for buying and selling.
params.price: price of the invest token w.r.t. the stable when strategy was created
params.stableRoundId: Round ID for the stable token price when the strategy is created.
params.strategyId: The unique ID of the strategy.
params.user: address of the user whose  for whose strategy is created

params.strategyId: The unique ID of the strategy.

cancelStrategy(uint256).details: This function allows users to cancel a trade execution strategy based on its unique ID.      When cancelled, the strategy's status is updated to "CANCELLED."

params.id: The unique ID of the strategy to cancel.

cancelStrategyOnBehalf(uint256,uint256,b.details: This function allows users to cancel a trade execution strategy based on its unique ID.      When cancelled, the strategy's status is updated to "CANCELLED."

params.id: The unique ID of the strategy to cancel.

createStrategy((address,uint256,address,.details: This function validates the input parameters to ensure they satisfy the criteria for creating a strategy.      If the parameters are valid, a new strategy is created and an event is emitted to indicate the successful creation.      If the parameters do not meet the criteria, an error is thrown.

params._parameter: The strategy parameters defining the behavior and conditions of the strategy.

createStrategyOnBehalf((address,address,.details: This function validates the input parameters to ensure they satisfy the criteria for creating a strategy.      If the parameters are valid, a new strategy is created and an event is emitted to indicate the successful creation.      If the parameters do not meet the criteria, an error is thrown.

params._parameter: The strategy parameters defining the behavior and conditions of the strategy.
params.account: The address of the user who created the strategy.
params.nonce: The nonce of the user who created the strategy.
params.permits: The array of `Permit` structs containing the parameters for the permit function.
params.signature: The signature of the user who created the strategy.

getMessageHashToCancel(uint256,uint256,a.details: This function returns the message hash that must be signed by the user in order to cancel a strategy on behalf of another user.

params.account: The address of the user who created the strategy.
params.nonce: The nonce of the user who created the strategy.

returns._0: The message hash for the given strategy.

getMessageHashToCreate((address,uint256,.details: This function returns the message hash that must be signed by the user in order to create a strategy on behalf of another user.

params._parameter: The strategy parameters defining the behavior and conditions of the strategy.
params.account: The address of the user who created the strategy.
params.nonce: The nonce of the user who created the strategy.

returns._0: The message hash for the given strategy.

getMessageHashToUpdate(uint256,(uint256,.details: This function returns the message hash that must be signed by the user in order to update a strategy on behalf of another user.

params.account: The address of the user who created the strategy.
params.nonce: The nonce of the user who created the strategy.

returns._0: The message hash for the given strategy.

getStrategy(uint256).details: This function allows users to query and retrieve information about a trade execution strategy      based on its unique ID.

params.id: The unique ID of the strategy to retrieve.

returns._0: A `Strategy` struct containing details of the specified strategy.

nextStrategyId().details: This function returns the unique ID that will be assigned to the next created strategy.

updateStrategy(uint256,(uint256,uint256,.details: Update an existing strategy with new parameters.

params.strategyId: The unique identifier of the strategy to update.
params.updateStruct: A struct containing the updated parameters for the strategy.

updateStrategyOnBehalf(uint256,(uint256,.details: Update an existing strategy with new parameters on behalf of another user.

params.account: The address of the user who created the strategy.
params.nonce: The nonce of the user who created the strategy.
params.signature: The signature of the user who created the strategy.
params.strategyId: The unique identifier of the strategy to update.
params.updateStruct: A struct containing the updated parameters for the strategy.

devdoc.title: StrategyFacet

StrategyCancelled(uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: Emitted when a trade execution strategy is cancelled.

StrategyCreated(uint256,address,(address.notice: Emitted when a new trading strategy is created.

StrategyUpdated(uint256,(address,uint256.notice: Emitted when a strategy is updated.

cancelStrategyOnBehalf(uint256,uint256,b.notice: Cancel a trade execution strategy on behalf of another user.

createStrategy((address,uint256,address,.notice: Create a new trade execution strategy based on the provided parameters.

createStrategyOnBehalf((address,address,.notice: Create a new trade execution strategy based on the provided parameters on behalf of another user.

getMessageHashToCancel(uint256,uint256,a.notice: Get the message hash for a given strategy to cancel.

getMessageHashToCreate((address,uint256,.notice: Get the message hash for a given strategy to create it.

getMessageHashToUpdate(uint256,(uint256,.notice: Get the message hash for a given strategy to update it.

getStrategy(uint256).notice: Retrieve the details of a trade execution strategy.

nextStrategyId().notice: Get the next available strategy ID.

userdoc.notice: This contract handles the creation, retrieval, and cancellation of strategies. Strategies define specific trade execution conditions and actions.
